intro: Ageratum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue, purple, or white, and bloom from summer to autumn. Ageratum mexicanum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
